descriptions: If you have mild depression, you should wait a while to see if it goes away on its own. In this case, after 2 weeks you will see the result.
There is evidence that exercise can help with depression, and it is one of the main treatments for mild depression. You may be assigned to group classes.

Talking about your feelings can be helpful. You can talk to a friend or relative, and ask your GP or local mental health service if there are any self-help groups for people with depression in your area.

Antidepressants are medicines that treat the symptoms of depression. There are many different types of antidepressants.

They should be prescribed by a doctor, usually for moderate to severe depression.
